contentrichtext.text: '''ENT Ltd''', standing for Examiner-Northern TV Ltd, was a [[Launceston, Tasmania]], [[Australia]] based media company owned by [[Edmund Rouse]], which was sold off in the early 1990s after a bribery scandal. Previous entities in direct control of ENT Ltd included: ==Radio stations== {{col-start}} {{col-2}} *[[7EX]] [[Launceston, Tasmania|Launceston]] (now ''Chilli 90.1fm'') *[[7HT]] [[Hobart, Tasmania|Hobart]] (now ''Heart 107.3'') *[[3SR]] [[Shepparton, Victoria|Shepparton]] *[[3UL]] [[Warragul, Victoria|Warragul]] (now (now ''531 3GG'') {{col-2}} *[[3UZ]] [[Melbourne]] (now ''[[Sport 927]]'') *Four Californian radio stations *Two Oregon radio stations {{col-end}} ==Television stations== {{col-start}} {{col-2}} '''TasTV''' *[[TVT-6]] [[Hobart, Tasmania|Hobart]] (now ''WIN Tasmania'') *[[TNT-9]] [[Launceston, Tasmania|Launceston]] (now ''Southern Cross Tasmania'') {{col-2}} '''The Six Network''' (later '''VIC Television''') *[[BTV-6]] [[Ballarat, Victoria|Ballarat]] (now ''WIN Victoria'') *[[GMV-6]] [[Shepparton, Victoria|Shepparton]] (now ''WIN Victoria'') *[[STV-8]] [[Mildura, Victoria|Mildura]] (now ''WIN Mildura'') {{col-end}} ==Other entities== {{col-start}} {{col-2}} *[[The Examiner (Tasmania)|The Examiner]] newspaper (Launceston) *[[Holymans]] (shipping) {{col-2}} *[[Gunns]] (forestry) *[[Filmpac Holdings]] (film production) {{col-end}} ENT’s 1988 annual report described the company’s principal activities as television, newspapers, radio, commercial printing, motels, travel agencies, picture theatres, property development and investment. <!-- (More details of bribery scandal needed here.) --> ==External links== * {{PDFlink|[http://eprint.uq.edu.au/archive/00000280/01/tanner95.pdf The Rise and Fall of Edmund Rouse]|92 KB}} [[Category:Defunct media companies of Australia]]
